chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 16 - Use/Threat of Force/Violence

result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Barr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew J Barr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew J Barr was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Undego cognitive thinking therapy.
Pay supervision fees as determined by the  Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
Complete AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming.

Provide DNA sample for the data bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm  or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

to Seal, signed and filed.

Defendant Matthew J Barr in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Matthew J Barr in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the court.  Additional statements by: Rev. Joseph Ellwanger.
The Court imposes the following Bifurcated Sentence:
Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be for 60 MONTHS consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for 24 MONTHS with credit for 97 days time served.  Defendant shall serve 36 MONTHS on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and/or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  The Court advised the defendant of his determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form 1910 R1.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $125.62 payable to Melissa K.  The Court ordered that all appropriate costs, surcharges, restitution and special assessments be paid from up to 25% of all  prison funds and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
1)  Undergo Sex Offender treatment and counseling programming.  Court ordered defendant to register as a Sex Offender and can never have employment/volunteer where he will supervise or work with children under the age of 17 years.
3)  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY from illegal drugs.
4)  Undergo cognitive thinking therapy.
5)  Complete AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
6)  No contact with HMK (dob: 12/19/99) or her mother.
5)  No social media participation.  If a computer is obtained, you must make it available to your parole agent for inspection upon demand.
6)  No unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 17 years, except your own children.
7)  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
8)  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
9)  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
10) Pay all costs, fees, assessments and restitution, any cash bail to apply.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
11) Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court ordered letter from defense counsel sealed until 7-31-2015.
FILED:
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Letter with attached copies of letters of support from Atty. G. Renden, dated July 30, 2014
Clerk:  jms
Letter to the Court dated July 27, 2014 from Rev. Joseph Ellwanger.

Plea hearing proceeded. Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1 as AMENDED-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Court advised the defendant he will have to register as a sex offender. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody. Case adjourned to Branch 25.

Defendant Matthew J Barr in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Defendant Matthew J Barr in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. 
As to COUNT 2- Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed.

As to COUNT 1- On oral motion of the State, Court amended charges to Second Degree Sexual Assault of a Child, contrary to sec. 948.02(2) Wis. Stats., a class C Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Expert Testimony received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Case recalled. Appearances remain the same. Defense made oral motion to modify the no contact order to allow the defendant to contact his minor children. State does not object. Court modified the no contact order to allow the defendant to call or write to his biological children.

Attorney Gregory A Renden in court, defendant Matthew J Barr not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for this hearing. Defense counsel requests projected plea date. Case adjourned to Branch 25. Plea Hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 1:30 p.m.

Attorney Gregory A Renden in court, defendant Matthew J Barr not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Court waived defendant's appearance for this hearing. Defense counsel has not received all discovery or an offer from the State yet. Parties requested adjourned date to allow for all the discovery to be put together and turned over to defense. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Matthew J Barr in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Defendant Matthew J Barr in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Borowski.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Rothstein, Br. 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with HMK dob 12/19/99; her family; residence; school or work.  No unsupervised contact with children age 17 or younger

Defendant Matthew J Barr in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Defendant Matthew J Barr in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
